facts.text: Houston Dynamo Football Club was established on December 15, 2005.
The Houston Dynamo won the MLS Cup in their first two seasons, 2006 and 2007.
The Dynamo have won the U.S. Open Cup twice, in 2018 and 2023.
Houston Dynamo were MLS Cup runners-up in 2011 and 2012.
The club moved to Shell Energy Stadium during the 2012 season.
Ted Segal became the majority owner of the Houston Dynamo after buying out his remaining minority partners in August 2022.
The San Jose Earthquakes' players and staff were relocated to Houston to form the Dynamo after the 2005 season.
The Earthquakes name, colors, and competition records were retained by the league for a possible expansion team when the team moved to Houston, and the San Jose team resumed play in 2008.
MLS Commissioner Don Garber announced on November 16, 2005, that the league had granted permission to relocate the San Jose Earthquakes for the 2006 season.
A ceremony was held outside Houston City Hall on December 16, 2005, to officially announce the franchise's arrival in Houston.
The Dynamo switched to the Eastern Conference in the MLS for the 2011 season due to the addition of teams in Vancouver and Portland.
Brad Davis led the league with 16 assists in the 2011 MLS season.
The Dynamo won the Eastern Conference semi-finals against the Philadelphia Union with a 3–1 aggregate score in 2011.
The Dynamo faced the Los Angeles Galaxy in the 2011 MLS Final.
The 2011 MLS Final was hosted at the Home Depot Center.
Landon Donovan scored the only goal in the 72nd minute of the 2011 MLS Final.
The Dynamo made a victorious home debut at their new stadium on May 12, 2012, against D.C. United.
The Dynamo had an unbeaten home record of 11–0–6 in the 2012 season.
The Dynamo defeated the top seed Sporting Kansas City 2–1 on aggregate in the 2012 Eastern Conference Semi-finals.
The Dynamo won against D.C. United 4–2 on aggregate in the 2012 Eastern Conference Finals.
The 2012 MLS Cup was hosted by L.A. with a sellout crowd of 30,510.
The Dynamo's 36-match unbeaten streak at home ended on May 12, 2013, against Sporting Kansas City.
The Dynamo clinched a playoff berth as a 4-seed with a 14–11–9 overall record in the 2013 season.
Will Bruin scored a brace in the MLS Wildcard Match against Montreal in the postseason at BBVA Stadium.
The Houston Dynamo FC was officially welcomed as an MLS franchise on December 16, 2005.
The Houston Dynamo FC underwent a rebranding, announcing a new vision and brand identity on November 17, 2020.
Ted Segal completed the purchase of the Houston Dynamo and Dash, as reported by The New York Times on June 7, 2024.
The Houston Dynamo FC signed Mexican National Team captain Héctor Herrera as a Designated Player on August 11, 2022.
Ben Olsen was hired as the head coach of Houston Dynamo FC, with the announcement date not explicitly provided in the text.
U.S. Men's National Team legend Tim Howard was added to the Houston Dynamo FC's ownership group, as announced on August 5, 2024.
The original name for the Houston MLS team was Houston 1836, announced on January 25, 2006, before being changed to Houston Dynamo on March 7, 2006.
Dynamo & Dash announced major upgrades to PNC Stadium ahead of the 2023 season, with the announcement made on June 7, 2024.
Which team won the MLS Cup in 1998? Chicago Fire
In what year did the MLS Cup not held for the first time since its inception? 2000
Which team was the first to win back-to-back MLS Cups in the 21st century? Houston Dynamo (2006, 2007)
Which team won the U.S. Open Cup in 1999, breaking the dominance of MLS teams for that year? Rochester Rhinos
How many consecutive U.S. Open Cups did the Seattle Sounders FC win starting from 2009? Three (2009, 2010, 2011)
In what year did Los Angeles FC win its first MLS Cup? 2022
Which team won the U.S. Open Cup in both 2017 and 2024? Sporting Kansas City (2017), Los Angeles FC (2024)
What was the outcome of the U.S. Open Cup in 2020 and 2021? None (The tournament was not held)
Which team achieved the feat of winning the MLS Cup in its inaugural season? Chicago Fire (1998)
As of 2024, which team has won the most MLS Cups? LA Galaxy
Reliant Stadium hosted the 2010 MLS All-Star Game.
Robertson Stadium had a capacity of 32,000 and was used from 2006 to 2011.
Shell Energy Stadium has been in use since 2012 with a capacity of 20,656.
Aggie Soccer Stadium hosted a CONCACAF Champions' League game and a US Open Cup game in 2007 and 2011, respectively.
Dominic Kinnear served as a coach from December 16, 2005, to October 25, 2014, winning 38.8% of his games.
Carl Lewis Track & Field Stadium hosted a U.S. Open Cup game in 2006.
Reliant Stadium hosted its first MLS regular season game in 2006 as part of a doubleheader featuring FC Barcelona vs. Club América.
